text: When it comes to securing your data,
it is important to thoughtfully and carefully manage your network.
This involves supervising and controlling the transit of data between applications, resources, and nodes.
When you migrate your network to the cloud, you have access to interfaces,
data movement, and security mechanisms like firewalls and encryption
with the ability to manage all of these resources in a unified manner,
through Application Programming Interfaces.
Proper network management is key to making sure you are doing business in the cloud securely
It’s all about building a secure
isolated, distributed,
and highly resilient network construct that works for you
no matter what your workload requirements.
And that’s where AWS comes in.
Our suite of Network Management tools
has all the services and features you need to help you secure and manage your network in the cloud.
For example, Amazon API Gateway lets you build,
deploy, and manage APIs at any scale.
Amazon VPC enables you to provision an isolated cloud resource.
Elastic Load Balancing enables you to build secure,
highly available, scalable, performant applications
by distributing your traffic across targets, like EC2 instances,
ECS/EKS containers, or Lambda functions.
AWS Global Accelerator helps you improve the availability and performance of your applications.
And CloudFront brings your data and applications closer to your viewers
with robust security and accelerated performance.
Let AWS be your partner. We’ll help you determine which tools work best for you
to manage your network in the cloud, and keep your data secure.
To learn more about Network Management, go to aws.amazon.com/security
